text: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
An eye for an eye makes the whole world blind.
He who digs a pit for others falls into it himself.
The first to apologize is the bravest. The first to forgive is the strongest. The first to forget is the happiest.
Make happiness your priority and be gentle with yourself in the process.
The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
War does not determine who is right - only who is left.
To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
Empty vessels make the most sound.
A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
Don't put off until tomorrow what you can do today.
Where there's smoke, there's fire.
All that glitters is not gold.
A small leak will sink a great ship.
A chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
If you lie down with dogs, you get up with fleas.
A hungry belly has no ears.
He who hesitates is lost.
If the wind will not serve, take to the oars.
To know the road ahead, ask those coming back.
Even a fish wouldn't get caught if it kept its mouth shut.
Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
When angry, count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred. By then, your opponent will have left the room.
A wise man once said nothing. This was probably his wisest moment.
Three things are certain in life: death, taxes, and someone disagreeing with you.
The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.
Before you criticize someone, walk a mile in their shoes. That way, you'll be a mile away and you'll have their shoes.
Knowledge is knowing a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is not putting it in a fruit salad.
The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person doing it.
The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.
A true friend is one who throws a rug over your mistakes, not one who pulls the rug out from under you.
He who asks a question is a fool for five minutes; he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
Prepare the umbrella before it rains, not after you're already wet.
The enemy of my enemy is my friend... until they become my enemy too.
An army marches on its stomach. A wise general knows where the best taverns are.
There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man.
If you're going through hell, keep going. The exit isn't behind you.
Never argue with a fool. Onlookers may not be able to tell the difference.
The wise warrior avoids the battle. The foolish commander insists on fighting even when outnumbered.
There are two kinds of people in the world: those who divide people into two groups, and those who don't.
Be like the lotus flower that grows in the mud but remains clean and fragrant.
He who knows does not speak. He who speaks does not know... unless they're a politician.
A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving. A lost traveler says the same thing.
He who laughs last didn't get the joke.
Don't judge a book by its cover, but do judge a tavern by its clientele.
No man is an island, but some men are peninsulas - difficult to reach and not worth the journey.
Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
Fools rush in where angels fear to tread. Both end up in interesting places.
People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones. Or change clothes with the curtains open.
Marry in haste, repent at leisure. The wise take their time in all important matters.
A watched pot never boils, but an unwatched pot boils over. Such is life's irony.
Only a fool tests the depth of the water with both feet.
If you want to go quickly, go alone. If you want to go far, go together. If you want to get lost, follow the crowd.
The sun does not forget a village just because it is small.
When two elephants fight, it is the grass that suffers.
Patience is the key to paradise, but impatience is often more entertaining.
The first step to wisdom is silence. The second is listening. The third is admitting when you didn't hear anything.
A known mistake is better than an unknown truth.
The axe forgets, but the tree remembers.
A beautiful thing is never perfect. And a perfect thing is rarely beautiful.
One hand cannot clap alone. Neither can it hold a cup of tea properly.
A fox is not caught twice in the same snare. A wise man is not fooled twice by the same trick.
Even monkeys fall from trees. Experts make mistakes too.
Dress a monkey in silk and it is still a monkey. Dress a fool in wisdom and they'll speak nonsense beautifully.
Vision without action is a daydream; action without vision is a nightmare.
The nail that sticks out gets hammered down. But the nail that's too short never holds anything together.
Do not speak unless you can improve on silence. And silence is hard to improve upon.
The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall. The most entertaining stories come from those who fall spectacularly.
When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on. Or learn to make rope.
Only dead fish go with the flow. Live ones can swim against the current.
The best revenge is not to be like your enemy. The second best is to outlive them.
The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails; the fool blames the gods.
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated. Then we complain about the complications.
A wise man changes his mind, a fool never will. A politician changes his mind but pretends he never did.
First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win... unless they have a bigger army.
You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs. You also can't make one without knowing how to cook.
A wolf in sheep's clothing will still leave wolf footprints. Look for the signs, not just the appearance.
A candle loses nothing by lighting another candle. A wise man loses nothing by teaching others.
The expert in anything was once a beginner. The master of nothing was always a know-it-all.
One generation plants the trees; another gets the shade. The third generation cuts them down for paper.
It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see. Two men may see the same sunset; one sees beauty, the other sees the end of working hours.
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts. Perseverance is more important than being right the first time.
A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for. Neither is a mind kept ignorant what brains are made for.
Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn. Bore me and I'll pretend to listen.
There are no shortcuts to any place worth going. Those who claim to know shortcuts are usually lost themselves.
You must be the change you wish to see in the world. Complaining changes nothing.
The early bird catches the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.
A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything.
The greatest wealth is health. The second greatest is having someone who reminds you to eat your vegetables.
Fortune favors the bold. Misfortune favors them as well, but tells better stories.
If you speak the truth, have a foot in the stirrup. Truth-tellers should be ready for a quick escape.
If you want to test a man's character, give him power. If you want to test his wisdom, give him wealth.
A lazy man will tell you that hard work never killed anyone, but why take the chance?
The bee stings and dies. The wasp stings and laughs. Choose your battles wisely.
A problem shared is a problem halved. A joy shared is a joy doubled.
The wise don't need advice. Fools won't take it.
A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees. One sees firewood, the other sees sanctuary.
A tree is known by its fruit, not by its leaves. A person is known by their actions, not their words.
Doubt is the beginning of wisdom. Certainty is the beginning of folly.
The wise person possesses humility. They know what they do not know.
The older I grow, the more I listen to people who don't talk much.
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones. The woman who directs him often accomplishes more.
When an elder dies, a library burns. When a fool dies, a source of bad advice is gone.
A society grows great when old men plant trees in whose shade they know they shall never sit. Politicians cut them down for short-term gain.
Children need models more than critics. They do what you do, not what you say.
The pen is mightier than the sword, but neither is as effective as a well-placed bribe.
He who knows not and knows not that he knows not is a fool - shun him. He who knows not and knows that he knows not is a student - teach him.
If fifty million people say a foolish thing, it is still a foolish thing.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall. But the wiser they are, the less likely they are to fall at all.
No garden is without its weeds. No mind is without its follies.
The best time to start was yesterday. The next best time is now. The worst time is 'tomorrow'.
The wise speak because they have something to say; fools speak because they have to say something.
Every man is a fool in some man's opinion. And every man is right about that, at least once.
The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.
A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it. A woman knew it was there all along.
You cannot step into the same river twice, for other waters are continually flowing in. But you can fall into the same mistake repeatedly.
